comments.body: Do `automake` and `libtool` belong in the Docker image?

Not according to manylinux. That said, they are pretty fundamental for some builds... I'd say we need to separate core dependencies from build dependencies on our build OSes. In practice, that might mean we want a `automake` distribution which we can mark as a build dep of udunits2...

> Not according to manylinux.

I have the feeling that `manylinux` does not seem to be addressing build tools. It looked to me that the discussion was focused on libraries and dependencies. (I might be wrong as I haven't read much about it yet.)

> In practice, that might mean we want a `automake` distribution which we can mark as a build dep of udunits2.

I will take a look into that.

The manylinux Docker image [does include a number of build tools](https://github.com/pypa/manylinux/blob/3a51d5cece16c432cc4d7097414ebbc1da7eec14/docker/build_scripts/build.sh#L34-L40) including `automake` but not `libtool` is included.

> The manylinux Docker image does include a number of build tools including automake but not libtool is included.

Good!  I am preparing those as packages, but we might be better with off using `manylinux`.
